title: Additional Nodal Metastasis Nomogram
description: Predicts probability of additional non-sentinel lymph node metastases in breast cancer patients with a positive sentinel node biopsy

parameters.name: multifocal
parameters.description: Multifocal tumor (cancer in multiple locations in breast)

parameters.name: negative_slns
parameters.description: Number of negative sentinel lymph nodes

parameters.name: positive_slns
parameters.description: Number of positive sentinel lymph nodes

parameters.name: pathologic_size
parameters.description: Pathologic size of tumor in centimeters

parameters.name: detection_method
parameters.description: Method of detection of sentinel lymph node metastases

result.name: probability
result.description: Probability of additional non-sentinel lymph node metastases

ranges.interpretation: Very low probability (<10%) of additional non-sentinel lymph node metastases. Consider omitting completion axillary lymph node dissection.
Low probability (10-20%) of additional non-sentinel lymph node metastases. Clinical decision-making should incorporate patient factors and preferences.
Moderate probability (20-50%) of additional non-sentinel lymph node metastases. Consider completion axillary lymph node dissection or axillary radiation therapy.
High probability (>50%) of additional non-sentinel lymph node metastases. Strong consideration for completion axillary lymph node dissection or axillary radiation therapy.

references: Van Zee KJ, Manasseh DM, Bevilacqua JL, Boolbol SK, Fey JV, Tan LK, Borgen PI, Cody HS 3rd, Kattan MW. A nomogram for predicting the likelihood of additional nodal metastases in breast cancer patients with a positive sentinel node biopsy. Ann Surg Oncol. 2003 Dec;10(10):1140-51.

Specht MC, Kattan MW, Gonen M, Fey J, Van Zee KJ. Predicting nonsentinel node status after positive sentinel lymph biopsy for breast cancer: clinicians versus nomogram. Ann Surg Oncol. 2005 Aug;12(8):654-9.
formula: Linear predictor = β₀ + β₁(nuclear grade) + β₂(LVI) + β₃(multifocal) + β₄(ER status) + β₅(negative SLNs) + β₆(positive SLNs) + β₇(pathologic size) + β₈(detection method). Probability = exp(linear predictor) / (1 + exp(linear predictor))
notes: This nomogram was developed and validated at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center
Applies to breast cancer patients with positive sentinel lymph node biopsy
Decision thresholds may vary by institution and should incorporate patient factors
Modern practice often considers axillary radiation as alternative to completion dissection
